contentList:
Anosmia -- Cold damage -- You lose your sense of smell and taste. You automatically fail any ability checks that involve your sense of smell or taste. The condition heals if you receive any magical healing. Anosmia is intended Cold damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You lose your sense of smell and taste. You're immune to smells and tastes that would make you Nauseous.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. You lose your sense of smell and taste. You're immune to smells and tastes that would make you Nauseous.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Blindness -- Acid and Radiant damage -- Your eyes are destroyed; you gain the blinded condition. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore your sight. Blindness is intended for Acid and Radiant damage. Acquiring Partial Blindness twice will induce Blindness.
Intended severity: High.
Your eyes are destroyed; you have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls, the range of your attacks and spells are reduced to [1].
Attack Rolls against Blinded creatures have Advantage.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate can restore your sight. Your eyes are destroyed; you have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls, the range of your attacks and spells are reduced to [1].
Attack Rolls against Blinded creatures have Advantage.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate can restore your sight. Blisters -- Acid and Fire damage -- You have severe blisters. You have disadvantage on Dexterity checks. The blisters heal if you receive magical healing. Alternatively, someone can tend to the blisters and make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check once every 24 hours. After seven successes, the blisters heal. Blindness is intended for Acid and Fire damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You have severe blisters. You have Disadvantage on Dexterity Ability Checks.
The blisters heal when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. You have severe blisters. You have Disadvantage on Dexterity Ability Checks.
The blisters heal when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Brain Injury -- Bludgeoning, Lightning, Psychic and Thunder danage -- You have suffered a brain injury. You have disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma checks, as well as Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws. If you fail a saving throw against bludgeoning damage, force damage, or psychic damage, you are also stunned until the end of your next turn. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore your full brain function. Brain Injury is intended for Bludgeoning, Lightning, Psychic and Thunder danage damage.
Intended severity: High.
You have suffered a brain injury. You have Disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Ability Checks and Saving Throws. If you fail a Saving Throw against bludgeoning damage, force damage, or psychic damage, you are also Stunned until the end of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate spell can restore your brain function. You have suffered a brain injury. You have Disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Ability Checks and Saving Throws. If you fail a Saving Throw against bludgeoning damage, force damage, or psychic damage, you are also Stunned until the end of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate spell can restore your brain function. Plane Splitting Brain Injury -- Force Damage -- You have suffered a brain injury. Your mind exists in two planes of reality, one real and one borne of raw magic. You constantly shift between the two, seeing or hearing things that may not exist. You have disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma checks, as well as Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws. If you fail a saving throw against bludgeoning damage, force damage, or psychic damage, you are also stunned until the end of your next turn. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore your full brain functions. You have suffered a brain injury. Your mind exists in two planes of reality, one real and one borne of rawmagic. You constantly shift between the two, seeing or hearing things that may not exist. You have Disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Ability Checks and Saving Throws. If you fail a Saving Throw against bludgeoning damage, force damage, or psychic damage, you are also Stunned until the end of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate spell can restore your brain function. Spiritual Injury -- Necrotic damage -- You are afflicted with intense apathy and depression. You have disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma ability checks and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws. Magic such as the heal or regenerate spell can resolve your spiritual injury, but such spells must be cast by a cleric, druid, or other class that uses divine magic. You are afflicted with intense apathy and depression. You have Disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Ability Checks and Saving Throws. If you fail a Saving Throw against bludgeoning damage, force damage, or psychic damage, you are also Stunned until the end of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate spell can resolve your spiritual injury. Broken Nose -- Bludgeoning damage -- Your broken nose is painful but doesn't have any adverse effect. Any magical healing mends your nose,although it may heal crooked if it is crooked when the healing is applied. Broken Nose is intended Bludgeoning damage.
Intended severity: Low.
Your broken nose is painful but doesn't have any adverse effect.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Your broken nose is painful but doesn't have any adverse effect.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. First Degree Burns -- Fire damage -- You have superficial but painful burns. Whenever you take fire damage, you take an additional point of damage. Magical healing cures the burns; alternatively, they will heal on their own in 2 weeks. If you already have first degree burns, you instead suffer second degree burns. First Degree Burns is intended for Fire damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You have superficial but painful burns. Whenever you take Fire damage, you take an additional [1]. If you already have First Degree Burns, you instead suffer from Second Degree Burns.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. You have superficial but painful burns. Whenever you take Fire damage, you take an additional [1]. If you already have First Degree Burns, you instead suffer from Second Degree Burns.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Second Degree Burns -- Fire damage -- You have disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution checks. Magic such as the regenerate spell cures this damage. Alternatively, they will heal on their own in 4 weeks. If you already have second degree burns, you instead suffer third degree burns. First Degree Burns is intended for Fire damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You have superficial but painful burns. Whenever you take Fire damage, you take an additional [1]. If you already have First Degree Burns, you instead suffer from Second Degree Burns.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. You have superficial but painful burns. Whenever you take Fire damage, you take an additional [1]. If you already have First Degree Burns, you instead suffer from Second Degree Burns.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Destroyed Foot -- Acid damage -- Your speed on foot is halved, and you must use a crutch or cane to move. You fall prone after using the Dash action. You have disadvantage on Dexterity checks made to balance. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. Destroyed foot is intended for Acid, Bludgeoning, Cold and Lightning damage.
Intended severity: Medium.
Your Movement Speed is halved. If you use the Dash action you fall Prone at the end of your turn. You have Disadvantage on Acrobatics checks.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. Your Movement Speed is halved. If you use the Dash action you fall Prone at the end of your turn. You have Disadvantage on Acrobatics checks.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. Gangrene of the Foot -- Cold damage Explosive Grounding of the Foot -- Lightning damage Broken Leg -- Bludgeoning damage Destroyed Hand -- Acid damage. -- You can no longer hold anything with two hands, and you can hold only a single object at a time. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the lost appendage. Destroyed Hand is intended for Acid, Cold, Lightning and Bludgeoning damage.
Intended severity: High.
You are Disarmed upon being injured. You have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls as well as Strength and Dexterity Ability Checks while you're dual wielding melee or ranged weapons, wielding a two handed weapon or have a shield equipped.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. You are Disarmed upon being injured. You have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls as well as Strength and Dexterity Ability Checks while you're dual wielding melee or ranged weapons, wielding a two handed weapon or have a shield equipped.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. Gangrene of the Hand -- Cold damage Explosive Grounding of the Hand -- Lightning damage Broken Arm -- Bludgeoning Damage Frostbitten Foot -- Cold damage -- Your speed on foot is reduced by 5 feet. You must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw after using the Dash action. If you fail the save, you fall prone. Magical healing cures the frostbite. Alternatively, your foot can be treated with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check, in which case it will heal naturally in 2 weeks. Frostbitten Foot is intended for Cold damage.
Intended severity: Medium.
Your Movement Speed is reduced by [1]. You must make a Dexterity Saving Throw after using the Dash action or fall Prone at the end of your turn.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Your Movement Speed is reduced by [1]. You must make a Dexterity Saving Throw after using the Dash action or fall Prone at the end of your turn.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Frostbitten Hand -- Cold damage -- Randomly determine which hand has been frostbitten. In order to grasp or manipulate an object with that hand, you must succeed at a DC 15 Dexterity check. Magical healing cures the frostbite. Alternatively, your hand can be treated with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check, in which case it will heal naturally in 2 weeks. Frostbitten Hand is intended for Cold damage.
Intended severity: Medium.
At the beginning of your turn in combat you must succeed a Dexterity Saving Throw. On a failed save, you suffer from Disadvantage on Attack Rolls as well as Strength and Dexterity Ability Checks if you're dual wielding melee or ranged weapons, wielding a two handed weapon or have a shield equipped.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. At the beginning of your turn in combat you must succeed a Dexterity Saving Throw. On a failed save you suffer from Disadvantage on Attack Rolls as well as Strength and Dexterity Ability Checks if you're dual wielding melee or ranged weapons, wielding a two handed weapon or have a shield equipped.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Horrible Disfigurement -- Acid damage -- You have burn scars to the extent that they can't be easily concealed. You have disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as heal or regenerate, removes the burn scars. -- You have acid burns to the extent that the scars can't be easily concealed. You have disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as heal or regenerate, remove the acid burn scar. Horrible Disfigurement is intended for Acid damage.
Intended severity: Medium.
You have burn scars to the extent that they cannot be easily concealed. You have Disadvantage on Persuasion checks and Advantage on Intimidation checks.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate removes the burn scars. You have burn scars to the extent that they cannot be easily concealed. You have Disadvantage on Persuasion checks and Advantage on Intimidation checks.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate removes the burn scars. You have acid burn scars to the extent that they cannot be easily concealed. You have Disadvantage on Persuasion checks and Advantage on Intimidation checks.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate remove the acid burn scar. Major Concussion -- Bludgeoning damage -- You have disadvantage on Intelligence checks, Wisdom checks, and Charisma checks, as well as Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as heal or regenerate, cures the concussion. Alternatively, it heals on its own in four weeks. Major Concussion is intended for Bludgeoning damage.
Intended severity: Medium.
You have Disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Ability Checks, as well as Constitution Saving Throws to maintain Concentration.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate cures the concussion. You have Disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Ability Checks, as well as Constitution Saving Throws to maintain Concentration.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate cures the concussion. Major Neuralgia -- Acid, Cold and Fire damage -- You are in constant pain from nerve damage. Whenever you attempt an action in combat, you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you lose your action and can't use reactions until the start of your next turn. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as heal and regenerate, cures the neuralgia, or if you spend twenty days doing nothing but resting it resolves on its own. Major Neuralgia is intended for Acid, Bludgeoning, Cold and Fire damage. Acquiring Major Neuralgia will replace Minor Neuraliga, it's the same injury just with a higher DC saving throw.
Intended severity: High.
You are in constant pain from nerve damage. At the beginning of your turn in combat you must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, you lose your Action and can't use Reactions until the start of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate cures the neuralgia. You are in constant pain from nerve damage. At the beginning of your turn in combat you must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, you lose your Action and can't use Reactions until the start of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate cures the neuralgia. Internal Injury Bludgeoning damage -- Whenever you attempt an action in combat, you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you lose your action and can't use reactions until the start of your next turn. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as heal or regenerate, repair the injury, or if you spend ten days doing nothing but resting, it will heal naturally. You are internally wounded. At the beginning of your turn in combat you must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, you lose your Action and can't use Reactions until the start of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate repair your insides. Minor Disfigurement -- Acid damage -- You have acid burn scars, but they don't have any adverse effect. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as heal or regenerate, remove the acid burn scars. Minor Disfigurement is intended for Acid damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You have acid burn scars, but they don't have any adverse effect.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate remove the acid burn scar. You have acid burn scars, but they don't have any adverse effect.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate remove the acid burn scar. Minor Neuralgia -- Acid, Cold and Fire damage -- This has the same effect as Major Neuralgia above, except that the save DC is 10 and it only takes ten days to resolve on its own. Minor Neuralgia is intended for Acid, Bludgeoning, Cold and Fire damage. Acquiring Major Neuralgia will replace Minor Neuraliga, it's the same injury with a higher DC saving throw.
Intended severity: Low.
You are in constant pain from nerve damage. Whenever you attempt an action in combat, you must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, you lose your Action and can't use Reactions until the start of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate cures the neuralgia. Broken Ribs -- Bludgeoning damage -- This has the same effect as Internal Injury above, except that the save DC is 10. Minor Concussion -- Bludgeoning damage -- You have disadvantage on Intelligence checks, Wisdom checks, and Charisma checks, as well as Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as heal or regenerate, cures the concussion. Alternatively, it heals on its own in four weeks. Minor Concussion is intended for Bludgeoning damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You have Disadvantage on Intelligence Ability Checks.
The concussion heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. You have Disadvantage on Intelligence Ability Checks.
The concussion heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Partial Blindness -- Acid, Cold, Fire, Piercing, Radiant and Slashing damage -- Your eyes are damaged; you have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on ranged attack rolls. Magic such as the regenerate spell can heal the damage to your eyes. If you have already suffered partial blindness, you're blinded. Partial Blindness is intended for Acid, Cold, Fire, Piercing, Radiant and Slashing damage. Acquiring Partial Blindness twice will induce Blindness.
Intended severity: High.
Your eyes are damaged. You have Disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and on ranged Attack Rolls. If you are already suffering from Partial Blindness and are inflicted with it again, you instead gain the Blindness injury.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate can restore your sight. Your eyes are damaged. You have Disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and on ranged Attack Rolls. If you are already suffering from Partial Blindness and are inflicted with it again, you instead gain the Blindness injury.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate can restore your sight. Ocular Damage -- Cold damage -- One of your corneas is damaged from frostbite. You have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on ranged attack rolls. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the damaged cornea. If you have no corneas that remain undamaged after sustaining this injury, you're blinded. One of your corneas is damaged from frostbite. You have Disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and on ranged Attack Rolls. If you are already suffering from Ocular Damage and are inflicted with it again, you instead gain the Blindness injury.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate can restore the damaged cornea. Severe Bruising -- Bludgeoning damage -- You suffer severe bruising over an extensive portion of your anatomy. Anytime you suffer bludgeoning or force damage, you suffer an additional point of bludgeoning or force damage. The bruising heals if you receive magical healing. Alternatively, it heals on its own in 2 weeks. Severe Bruising is intended for Bludgeoning damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You suffer severe bruising over an extensive portion of your anatomy. Anytime you suffer Bludgeoning or Force damage, you suffer an additional [1] or [2].
The bruising heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. You suffer severe bruising over an extensive portion of your anatomy. Anytime you suffer Bludgeoning or Force damage, you suffer an additional [1] or [2].
The bruising heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Systematic Damage -- Cold and Poison damage -- You have disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution ability checks and Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. Magic such as the regenerate spell cures this damage. Systematic Damage is intended for Cold and Poison damage.
Intended severity: High.
You have Disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution Ability Checks and Saving Throws.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate spell can cure the damage. You have Disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution Ability Checks and Saving Throws.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate spell can cure the damage.
